conclusion: To determine the volume of the irregularly shaped solid using the device shown in the figure, follow these steps
Place the irregularly shaped solid (B) into the U-shaped tube
Ensure the U-tube is in equilibrium with the mercury levels on both sides equal
Slowly add mercury to one side (right side) of the U-tube until the mercury level on the other side rises
Observe the change in the mercury level on the right side
The volume of mercury added can be calculated using the formula for the volume of a cylinder: V_mercury = A * h
The volume of mercury added is directly proportional to the volume of the solid displaced
The volume of the solid V_solid can be determined by the same volume of mercury added: V_solid = V_mercury
The volume of the irregularly shaped solid can be determined by measuring the volume of mercury added to the U-tube when the solid is placed inside it
